summary: Regenerative medicine restores or replaces human cells, tissues, or organs affected by disease. This may eventually help cure many conditions that are currently considered difficult to treat. For example, a patient's own cells could be used to create a personalized organ, which could eliminate the possibility that a patient's body will reject a donated organ. However, there are challenges with developing regenerative medicine technologies. We...
title: Regenerative Medicine: Therapeutic Applications, Challenges, and Policy Options
